title.narrative: INTEGRATED PPTCT/ PAIDS IN MCH

description.narrative: By 2017, PPTCT and Paediatric HIV services are integrated within mainstream MCH programmes, with an emphasis on 5 high HIV burden provinces., which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, PPTCT and Paediatric HIV services are integrated within mainstream MCH programmes, with an emphasis on 5 high HIV burden provinces.

sector.narrative: HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
PMTCT program support such as retention in care, family planning, infant feeding, infant medical male circumcision and community facility linkages
Procurement and or supply management for HIV diagnostics and medicine

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, PPTCT and Paediatric HIV services are integrated within mainstream MCH programmes, with an emphasis on 5 high HIV burdenprovinces.

description.narrative: The quality of PPTCT and pediatric HIV care services has been improved by rolling-out of the WHO recommended lifelong antiretroviral therapy for HIV infected pregnant women while the data shows fewer women and children have been reached in 2017 compared to 2016. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of health care facilities providing ANC services that offer HIV testing for pregnant women and their spouses.
Number of health care facilities providing ANC services that offer HIV testing for pregnant women and their spouses.
Health facilities providing life long ART for pregnant and breast feeding women within the MNCH setting

actual.value: 2016:60 health facilities are providing Option B+

title.narrative: Percentage of pregnant women whose partners were tested for HIV in the last 12 months
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of a national HIV and AIDS Prevention, PMTCT, Treatment and Care Strategy

target.value: 2016:Option B has been rolled out to all PPTCT sites

title.narrative: Health facilities that provide paediatric ART
Task-shifting or -sharing for non-physician health care providers to provide ART implemented
Percentage of HIV exposed infants receive HIV testing within the first two months of age
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Adoption of the 2015 WHO HIV treatment guidelines (which recommend that ART to be initiated in everyone living with HIV including children)

target.value: 2016:2015 WHO guidelines but not yet idely implemented
